page.title: 11WILMINGTON BRIDGE : HULL.
page.content: There are several bridges that cross the River Hull.Most of them carry road traffic and one is used for railway transport. The Wilmington Swing Bridge is unusual,however,because although it is an impressive bridge with a cabin perched aloft,it is only used for pedestrians and cycles. It was not built for this purpose- it was formerly used as a railway bridge- but the track was taken up several years ago.Since it is a public right of way it must still be manned to swing open when large ships want to move up or down river. Nowadays it is very peaceful and you can often see anglers casting their lines in the shadow of the bridge, for flounders or eels,away from the roar of the traffic and the rumble of the trains.
